text.0: large was that covering and firm of texture folded wherein thou enteredst the waters.
text.1: one deity alone o jātavedas agni saw all thy forms in sundry places.
text.2: what god hath seen me who of all their number clearly beheld my forms in many places.
text.3: where lie then all the sacred logs of agni that lead him godward varuṇa and mitra.
text.4: in many places agni jātavedas we sought thee hidden in the plants and waters.
text.5: then yama marked thee god of wondrous splendour effulgent from thy tenfold secret dwelling.
text.6: i fled in fear from sacrificial worship varuṇa lest the gods should thus engage me.
text.7: thus were my forms laid down in many places this as my goal i agni saw before me.
text.8: come man is pious and would fain do worship he waits prepared in gloom thou agni dwellest.
text.9: make pathways leading godward clear and easy and bear oblations with a kindly spirit.
text.10: this goal mine elder brothers erst selected as he who drives a car the way to travel.
text.11: sovaruṇa i fled afar through terror as flies the wildbull from an archers bowstring.
text.12: we give thee life unwasting jātavedas so that employed thou never shalt be injured.
text.13: so nobly born shalt thou with kindly spirit bear to the gods their share of mens oblations.
text.14: grant me the first oblations and the latter entire my forceful shares of holy presents.
text.15: the soul of plants the fatness of the waters and let there be long life ye gods to agni.
text.16: thine be the first oblations and the latter entire thy forceful shares of holy presents.
text.17: let all this sacrifice be thine o agni and let the worlds four regions how before thee.
